title: Château Couhins 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Soft and fruity, this is a generous wine that will develop quickly. It shows ripe red fruits and gentle tannins with wood flavors on the finish. Drink from 2022.

title: Chateau Dauzac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Firm tannins give this wine its structure while also supporting some bitter extraction flavors. It's a tough wine at this stage, just hinting at black currant fruit, though it offers plenty of acidity. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Reysson 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is bright in character, offering juicy black currant, lively acidity and a strong spice note. With this freshness, the wine will develop quickly and will be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Fernández Gómez 2016 Selección Familia White (Rioja)
description: One sniff announces that this Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca blend is fully oaked, while good acidity cuts some of the wine's resiny weight. While barrel-based flavors are firmly in charge, this offers apple and stone-fruit notes prior to a finish that tastes slightly buttery.

title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Melony aromas are leesy and a touch rich and flat. That's also how the palate comes across. Inexact nectarine flavors are plump and turn slightly bitter and yeasty on the finish. It's best to drink this right away.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 L'aplomb Ad Quadratum White (Alsace)
description: Very gentle hints of ripe orchard fruit lay on the nose while the palate has the richness of juicy, ripe pear. Easy and harmonious, fresh and lively. Drink soon.

title: Feliciana 2016 Felugan  (Lugana)
description: Tropical fruit and orange blossom aromas lead the nose. The round palate doles out white peach, citrus and honeydew melon alongside fresh acidity. A hint of bitter almond marks the finish.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2016 Fritz Willi Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: While delicate in concentration, this medium-sweet Riesling offers loads of pink grapefruit and honeysuckle tones calibrated by zesty lime and orange peel. It's a fresh, frisky wine, with a lingering honey finish.

title: Galil Mountain 2016 Syrah (Upper Galilee)
description: Aromas of the wood and anise lead to flavors of raspberry, strawberry, cured meat, smoke and eucalyptus. The tart cherry finish has notes of flint and smoke. Slightly grippy tannins and smoky flavors may be a little strong on their own, but this wine will work well alongside fatty cuts of meat.

title: Grattamacco 2016  Bolgheri
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Sangiovese opens with aromas of black currant, Mediterranean scrub and cedar. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Hayotzer 2014 Genesis Shiraz (Galilee)
description: Inky red-violet in the glass, this wine has aromas of black plum, cassis and juniper. It is bright on the palate, with smooth tannins that support flavors of cherry, cranberry, chocolate and violet. A quick splash of pomegranate arrives at the finish.

title: Hugel 2016 Cuvée Les Amours Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: An appealing aroma of ripe pear fills the nose. The palate is similarly abundant in fruit yet ultimately feels clean, dry and slender.

title: Jacob's Creek 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: This reserve Chardonnay is slightly buttery and yeasty on the fore, brightened by aromas of green apple, fresh melon and a hint of tropical fruit. The palate is tightly structured, with crunchy fruit, a chalky textural weight and a long, green-apple finish.

title: Johan 2014 Nils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a barrel selection, seemingly chosen for its muscular aspect. The estate's characteristic sweet baking spices are amply in evidence, with ginger-cookie highlights. Fermented with native yeast and aged for 18 months in one-quarter new French oak, it should continue to drink well into the mid-2020s.

title: La Selva 2014  Maremma Toscana
description: Made entirely with organically grown Ciliegiolo grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, raspberry and baking spice. On the vibrant palate, velvety tannins support red cherry, cinnamon and vanilla.

title: Mamete Prevostini 2013 Corte di Cama  (Sforzato di Valtellina)
description: Subtle aromas of vanilla, cedar and steeped prune slowly take shape on this. The dense palate offers dried black cherry, mocha, licorice and star anise alongside close-grained tannins.

title: Mamete Prevostini 2015 Sassella Sommarovina  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Crushed aromatic herb, underbrush and balsamic aromas lead the nose. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained, austere tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: MAN Family Wines 2015 Skaapveld Shiraz (Coastal Region)
description: This wine is decadent without going over the top, offering attractive aromas and flavors of mocha, black forest cake, brambly raspberry and cola spice. The medium-weight palate boasts slight creaminess and velvety tannins, lifted by ripe fruit flavors and ample acidity. Drink now.

title: Michele Satta 2016 Costa di Giulia White (Bolgheri)
description: A blend of 70% Vermentino and 30% Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of white peach, acacia flower and apricot. The aromas follow through to the ripe palate along with an almond note.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 V Collection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is fruit-forward and layered in powerful swathes of grape and cherry flavor, with aspects of earth, forest pine and cardamom seasoning throughout. The structure is moderate and the texture fleshy, with oak pronounced.

title: Nera 2013 Inferno Efesto  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Made with 100% Nebbiolo this has fresh aromas of wild red berry, violet and a whiff of star anise. The racy linear palate delivers pomegranate, sour cherry and dried alpine herb alongside vibrant acidity and taut, polished tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Nino Negri 2014 Le Tense  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Vibrant and linear, this opens with aromas of French oak, exotic spice and a whiff of wild rose. The palate has a nervous tension, offering oak-driven spice, sage and cranberry set against racy acidity and fine-grained tannins.

title: Palacios Remondo 2014 Placet Viura (Rioja)
description: Equal parts of peach pit, petrol and oak aromas drive this Viura towards a round, full palate. Nutty flavors of popcorn and dry fruits are modest but elevated, while this tastes similarly of stone fruits, salt and oak on the finish.

title: Patton Valley 2014 10 Acre Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Planted in 1997, this is the oldest estate vineyard. In this vintage it crafts an almost delicate wine, with a mix of dried herbs, mountain berry and earthy tannins. There's an overall sense of austerity, though it remains well balanced throughout.

title: Patton Valley 2014 West Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This block is singled out in order to present a wine that has received full western exposure throughout the growing season. Using a basket press and native yeast fermentation, it's a well-defined effort with ripe cherry fruit and a streak of cola running down the spine. Medium bodied and full in the midpalate, it fades gently, though just a bit sooner than you'd like.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Distraction Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry, tarragon, toasted coconut and anise show on the nose of this blend of 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 24% Merlot, 16% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec. The dark palate offers black currant, black plum, cocoa, light mint and crushed gravel on the finish. It's well structured.

title: Pierre Sparr 2016 One White (Alsace)
description: Just a hint of rose petal blends in with lemon on the nose. The palate shows the same flavors but lacks a little direction. Nonetheless, there is freshness in the rose and lemon flavors. Drink soon.

title: Podere Sapaio 2015 Volpolo  (Bolgheri)
description: Made with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot and 15% Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, tobacco and a whiff of green peppercorn. It's concentrated, offering black-currant jam, mocha and vanilla flavors alongside assertive tannins.

title: Porterhouse Winery 2014 Williams' Reserve Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: As ode to his family's butchering past, this red blend would go very well with one of the fatty steaks that winemaker Adam Comartin's relatives once cut. Aromas of licorice, sandalwood, lilac and jammy fruits lead into a palate loaded with clove, nutmeg, thyme and pepper spice, all set against a backdrop of boysenberry fruit.

title: Rocca di Montemassi 2015 Sassabruna  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made with 80% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 10% Syrah, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and tobacco. The smooth, savory palate offers Morello cherry, star anise and licorice alongside polished tannins.
